title: datalad diff would crash on an uninstalled submodule

labels.name: more-info-needed
labels.description: Key information is missing in order to efficiently tackle the issue

body:
#### What is the problem?
if submodule not installed, then upon `-r` it would crash
#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
in my case was on neurodebian-docker repo:
```
$> datalad diff -r
   modified(dataset): neurodebian
   modified(dataset): stackbrew
      modified(file): neurodebian/.travis.yml
   modified(dataset): neurodebian/3rd/bigmess
         added(file): neurodebian/README.md
           deleted(): neurodebian/Singularity
      modified(file): neurodebian/cmdsettings.sh
      modified(file): neurodebian/containers/singularity-neurodebian.def
      modified(file): neurodebian/neurodebian.cfg
         added(file): neurodebian/singularity/Singularity
         added(file): neurodebian/singularity/Singularity.obs
Failed to run ['git', '--work-tree=.', 'diff', '--raw', '-z', '--ignore-submodules=none', '--abbrev=40', '145aa3f06451754ab759b88c1dbb47c7081d5f47..4313ad8df00f5abb832db310476b166bb49487dd', '--'] under '/home/yoh/deb/gits/pkg-exppsy/neurodebian-dockerfiles/neurodebian/3rd/bigmess'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: Invalid revision range 145aa3f06451754ab759b88c1dbb47c7081d5f47..4313ad8df00f5abb832db310476b166bb49487dd
fatal: Invalid revision range 145aa3f06451754ab759b88c1dbb47c7081d5f47..4313ad8df00f5abb832db310476b166bb49487dd
$> datalad ls -r .
.                                    [git]  master  ✗ 2018-05-24/21:53:48  ✗
neurodebian                          [git]  master  sing-2.2.1-14-g02206e6 2018-05-17/11:24:53  ✓
neurodebian/3rd/bigmess              not installed
neurodebian/3rd/jquery.livetwitter   not installed
neurodebian/3rd/nvd3                 not installed
stackbrew                            [git]  master  ✗ 2017-07-26/18:12:34  ✗
```
#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
bleeding edge  0.10.0.rc4.dev47  (above output was with 0.9.3 but now verified that the same with this one)

#### Expected output
for submodule to have `impossible(file)` record of some kind instead of a crash
